intro: Gonostemon schinzii var. angolensis, commonly known as the Angola starleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
